intro: Styloncerus cunninghamii, commonly known as the Cunningham's styloncerus, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
